eba3e7c8-4683-40a2-971f-ccbf5d8da382.description: This badge holder has demonstrated their knowledge and expertise as a Speaker who has presented to a large group at the 2019 NICE K12 Cybersecurity Education Conference. As a presenter, they have been recognized for the understanding of their subject area and for contributing to cybersecurity education for the K12 community.
eba3e7c8-4683-40a2-971f-ccbf5d8da382.name: NICE K12 Cybersecurity Education Conference Presenter

issuer.summary: issued by NICE K12 Education Conference

alignments.name: NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework: Oversee and Govern
alignments.description: Training, Education, and Awareness: Conducts training of personnel within pertinent subject domain. Develops, plans, coordinates, delivers and/or evaluates training courses, methods, and techniques as appropriate.

alignments.name: NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standards
alignments.description: The core mission of the National Board for Professional Teaching Standards is to create field-specific standards for accomplished teaching that are grounded in the Five Core Propositions and that articulate the actions that accomplished teachers employ to advance student learning.

badge_template_activities.title: Submit a relevant topic and be selected to present by the NICE K12 Proposal Review Committee.

Successfully present area of expertise to attendees that include: K12 Faculty, K12 Administrators, Cybersecurity students, Employers, Colleges, Government Officials, and Business & Industry Representatives.
Complete overall conference survey.

NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standard III Knowledge of Content: Accomplished teachers utilize their technical and professional knowledge as well as their interdisciplinary and pedagogical skills to develop curricular objectives, design instruction, promote student learning, and facilitate student success within industry.

NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standard VIII Partnerships and Collaborations: Accomplished teachers collaborate with family, education, industry, and community partners to create challenging real world opportunities and support networks that help students plan, develop, and achieve their career goals.

NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standard IX Leadership in the Profession (All) Accomplished teachers collaborate with stakeholders within their schools and communities to improve instruction, promote student learning, and advocate for their fields of expertise in education and related industries.

b7d30130-d0de-45bc-aa1e-29aeb3fac055.description: Earners of the Attendee Badge participated in the 2019 NICE K12 Cybersecurity Education Conference in Orange County, California. The conference is focused on expanding the national effort to promote and increase K12 cybersecurity education programs on-going throughout the country. Badge earners attended at least 8 sessions and 2 keynote speeches focused on cybersecurity awareness, education, and career pathways.
b7d30130-d0de-45bc-aa1e-29aeb3fac055.name: NICE K12 Cybersecurity Education Conference Attendee

Attend at least 8 sessions plus 2 keynote speaker sessions and complete session feedback forms.

NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standard VI Postsecondary Readiness: Accomplished teachers facilitate career exploration and promote the acquisition of knowledge and skills so students can make informed career decisions that match their interests and aptitudes with the needs, expectations, and requirements of industry.

NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standard VIII Partnerships and Collaborations: Accomplished teachers collaborate with family, education, industry, and community partners to create challenging real world opportunities and support networks that help students plan, develop, and achieve their career goals.

NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standard VII Program Design and Management: Accomplished teachers design and promote quality programs aligned with industry demands. They manage materials and resources to enrich their programs and sustain meaningful educational experiences for their students.

7838834a-2aa6-478d-a7cc-ccdacc39b5a4.description: Earners of the Volunteer Badge volunteered at the 2019 NICE K12 Cybersecurity Education Conference in Orange County, California. The conference is focused on expanding the national effort to promote and increase K12 cybersecurity education programs on-going throughout the country. Badge earners volunteered and worked at least 2 breakout sessions or 1 workshop during the two main days of the conference.

badge_template_activities.title: Work at least 2 breakout sessions or one workshop during the two main days of the NICE K12 conference.

alignments.name: NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework
alignments.description: The NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework (NICE Framework), NIST Special Publication 800-181, is a national-focused resource that categorizes and describes cybersecurity work. The NICE Framework establishes a taxonomy and common lexicon that describes cybersecurity work and workers irrespective of where or for whom the work is performed.

alignments.name: NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standard
alignments.description: The core mission of the National Board for Professional Teaching Standards is to create field-specific standards for accomplished teaching that are grounded in the Five Core Propositions and that articulate the actions that accomplished teachers employ to advance student learning.

alignments.description: This course aligns with the NSA CAE-CD KU's Cybersecurity Foundations (CSF), Basic Cryptography (BCY), Basic Networking (BNW), Digital Forensics (DFS), Network Forensics (NWF) and Software Reverse Engineering (SRE)

badge_template_activities.title: Register for the 2019 NICE Cybersecurity Education Pre-Conference "Hacking Workshop: Hands-On with Capture the Flag."
Participant must attend the workshop and participate in all activities.
Participate in the course lecture and hands-on learning activities which includes a capture-the-flag competition.
Complete the feedback form for the Workshop using the Whova conference app.

NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standard IV: Learning Environments and Instructional Practices. Accomplished teachers design contextualized learning environments that foster critical thinking, creativity, leadership, teamwork, and communication skills while preparing students for postsecondary education and careers.

NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standard VI Postsecondary Readiness: Accomplished teachers facilitate career exploration and promote the acquisition of knowledge and skills so students can make informed career decisions that match their interests and aptitudes with the needs, expectations, and requirements of industry.

NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standard VIII Partnerships and Collaborations: Accomplished teachers collaborate with family, education, industry, and community partners to create challenging real world opportunities and support networks that help students plan, develop, and achieve their career goals.

NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standard VII Program Design and Management: Accomplished teachers design and promote quality programs aligned with industry demands. They manage materials and resources to enrich their programs and sustain meaningful educational experiences for their students.

NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standard Specialty Area: Information Systems and Technology. Accomplished CTE teachers in information systems and technology have a comprehensive understanding of the design, development, and management of computer software, hardware, and networks.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0001 - Knowledge of computer networking concepts and protocols, and network security methodologies.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0004 - Knowledge of cybersecurity and privacy principles.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0058 - Knowledge of network traffic analysis methods.

NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0109 - Knowledge of physical computer components and architectures, including the functions of various components and peripherals (e.g., CPUs, Network Interface Cards, data storage).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0392 - Knowledge of common computer/network infections (virus, Trojan, etc.) and methods of infection (ports, attachments, etc.).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0395 - Knowledge of computer networking fundamentals (i.e., basic computer components of a network, types of networks, etc.).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0427 - Knowledge of encryption algorithms and cyber capabilities/tools (e.g., SSL, PGP).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0435 - Knowledge of fundamental cyber concepts, principles, limitations, and effects.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0444 - Knowledge of how Internet applications work (SMTP email, web-based email, chat clients, VOIP).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0064 - Skill in developing and executing technical training programs and curricula.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0070 - Skill in talking to others to convey information effectively.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0072 - Skill in using scientific rules and methods to solve problems.

NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0211 - Skill in developing or recommending analytic approaches or solutions to problems and situations for which information is incomplete or for which no precedent exists.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0218 - Skill in evaluating information for reliability, validity, and relevance.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0289 - Skill in using multiple search engines (e.g., Google, Yahoo, LexisNexis, DataStar) and tools in conducting open-source searches.

NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0006 - Ability to prepare and deliver education and awareness briefings to ensure that systems, network, and data users are aware of and adhere to systems security policies and procedures.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0011 - Ability to answer questions in a clear and concise manner.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0012 - Ability to ask clarifying questions.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0013 - Ability to communicate complex information, concepts, or ideas in a confident and well-organized manner through verbal, written, and/or visual means.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0016 - Ability to facilitate small group discussions.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0017 - Ability to gauge learner understanding and knowledge level.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0018 - Ability to prepare and present briefings.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0055 - Ability to operate common network tools (e.g., ping, traceroute, nslookup).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0069 - Ability to apply collaborative skills and strategies.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0070 - Ability to apply critical reading/thinking skills.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0175 - Ability to examine digital media on multiple operating system platforms.

NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0059 - Knowledge of new and emerging information technology (IT) and cybersecurity technologies.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0208 - Knowledge of computer based training and e-learning services.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0226 - Knowledge of organizational training systems.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0246 - Knowledge of relevant concepts, procedures, software, equipment, and technology applications.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0250 - Knowledge of Test & Evaluation processes for learners.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0313 - Knowledge of external organizations and academic institutions with cyber focus (e.g., cyber curriculum/training and Research & Development).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0064 - Skill in developing and executing technical training programs and curricula.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0066 - Skill in identifying gaps in technical capabilities.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0100 - Skill in utilizing or developing learning activities (e.g., scenarios, instructional games, interactive exercises).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0101 - Skill in utilizing technologies (e.g., SmartBoards, websites, computers, projectors) for instructional purposes.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0271 - Skill in reviewing and editing assessment products.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0032 - Ability to develop curriculum for use within a virtual environment.

badge_template_activities.title: Register for the 2019 NICE Cybersecurity Education Pre-Conference Workshop "How to teach Palo Alto Network’s Cybersecurity Academy high school level content."
Participant must attend the workshop and participate in all activities.
Participate in the course lecture and hands-on learning activities that include fundamental cybersecurity concepts, networking, and network security.
Complete the feedback form for the Workshop using the Whova conference app.
Complete quiz assessments in all three courses with 80% or higher grade.

NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standard IV: Learning Environments and Instructional Practices. Accomplished teachers design contextualized learning environments that foster critical thinking, creativity, leadership, teamwork, and communication skills while preparing students for postsecondary education and careers.

NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standard VI Postsecondary Readiness: Accomplished teachers facilitate career exploration and promote the acquisition of knowledge and skills so students can make informed career decisions that match their interests and aptitudes with the needs, expectations, and requirements of industry.

NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standard VIII Partnerships and Collaborations: Accomplished teachers collaborate with family, education, industry, and community partners to create challenging real world opportunities and support networks that help students plan, develop, and achieve their career goals.

NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standard VII Program Design and Management: Accomplished teachers design and promote quality programs aligned with industry demands. They manage materials and resources to enrich their programs and sustain meaningful educational experiences for their students.

NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standard Specialty Area: Information Systems and Technology. Accomplished CTE teachers in information systems and technology have a comprehensive understanding of the design, development, and management of computer software, hardware, and networks.

NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0011 - Knowledge of capabilities and applications of network equipment including routers, switches, bridges, servers, transmission media, and related hardware.

NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0061 - Knowledge of how traffic flows across the network (e.g., Transmission Control Protocol [TCP] and Internet Protocol [IP], Open System Interconnection Model [OSI], Information Technology Infrastructure Library, current version [ITIL]).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0147 - Knowledge of emerging security issues, risks, and vulnerabilities.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0162 - Knowledge of cyber attackers (e.g., script kiddies, insider threat, non-nation state sponsored, and nation sponsored).

NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0177 - Knowledge of cyber attack stages (e.g., reconnaissance, scanning, enumeration, gaining access, escalation of privileges, maintaining access, network exploitation, covering tracks).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0471 - Knowledge of Internet network addressing (IP addresses, classless inter-domain routing, TCP/UDP port numbering).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0487 - Knowledge of network security (e.g., encryption, firewalls, authentication, honey pots, perimeter protection).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0627 - Knowledge of the importance of ingress filtering to protect against automated threats that rely on spoofed network addresses.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0629 - Knowledge of white/black listing.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0001 - Skill in conducting vulnerability scans and recognizing vulnerabilities in security systems.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0078 - Skill in recognizing and categorizing types of vulnerabilities and associated attacks.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0079 - Skill in protecting a network against malware. (e.g., NIPS, anti-malware, restrict/prevent external devices, spam filters).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0162 - Skill in sub-netting.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0168 - Skill in setting up physical or logical sub-networks that separate an internal local area network (LAN) from other untrusted networks.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0170 - Skill in configuring and utilizing computer protection components (e.g., hardware firewalls, servers, routers, as appropriate).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0107 - Ability to think like threat actors.

d4adbcf5-9c5d-4294-b5b7-050d8664865f.description: Earners of this Badge participated in the "Basic Hardware Programming, Circuit Building and Troubleshooting" workshop at the 2019 NICE K12 Cybersecurity Education Conference. This badge indicates earner successfully completed the full-day workshop where they learned to program a microcontroller, build electronic circuits and troubleshoot.

badge_template_activities.title: Register for the 2019 NICE Cybersecurity Education Pre-Conference Workshop "Getting Started with Python programming using the Microbit and cyber:bot robot kit"
Participant must attend the workshop and participate in all activities.
Participate in the course lecture and hands-on learning activities which includes Python programming: Followed Parallax instruction to complete Python programming tutorials

Participate in the course lecture and hands-on learning activities which include Electronic circuit building: Breadboarded circuits for bump detection using whiskers, light following with photoresistors and object detection with infrared.
Participate in the course lecture and hands-on learning activities which include Electronic troubleshooting and code debugging: Encountered errors between code, circuits and hardware.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0004 - Ability to develop curriculum that speaks to the topic at the appropriate level for the target audience.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework -A0005 - Ability of risk management processes (e.g., methods for assessing and mitigating risk).

NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0006 - Ability to prepare and deliver education and awareness briefings to ensure that systems, network, and data users are aware of and adhere to systems security policies and procedures.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0100 - Ability to perform wireless collection procedures to include decryption capabilities/tools.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0030 - Knowledge of electrical engineering as applied to computer architecture (e.g., circuit boards, processors, chips, and computer hardware).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0236 - Knowledge of how to utilize Hadoop, Java, Python, SQL, Hive, and PIG to explore data.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0375 - Knowledge of wireless applications vulnerabilities.

NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0523 - Knowledge of products and nomenclature of major vendors (e.g., security suites - Trend Micro, Symantec, McAfee, Outpost, and Panda) and how those products affect exploitation and reduce vulnerabilities.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0600 - Knowledge of the structure, architecture, and design of modern wireless communications systems.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0130 -Skill in writing scripts using R, Python, PIG, HIVE, SQL, etc.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0266 -  Skill in relevant programming languages (e.g., C++, Python, etc.).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework -T0612 - Conduct exploitation of wireless computer and digital networks.

c6f97db2-412d-4d3f-a302-ae63acae0e15.description: Earners of this Badge participated in the "Teaching IT Fundamentals+ Workshop" at the 2019 NICE K12 Cybersecurity Education Conference. This badge indicates earner competency relative to teaching a course that is focused on the exam objectives for the CompTIA ITF+ certification. The badge recipient has developed an understanding of the broad coverage associated with this certification, with a more detailed knowledge of exam content that is specifically related to the cybersecurity domain.

badge_template_activities.title: Register for the 2019 NICE Cybersecurity Education Pre-Conference "Teaching IT Fundamentals+ Workshop"
Participant must attend the workshop and participate in all activities.
Participate in the course lecture and hands-on learning activities which includes materials included in the Canvas course (quizzes, labs, etc.).
Complete the feedback form for the Workshop using the Whova conference app.

Completion of post-workshop survey designed to measure the effectiveness of the learning provided by the workshop, focusing on technical ITF+ content, as well as utilization of the Canvas LMS environment.
Take the IT Fundamentals+ Certification Exam. If passed, participant will receive the ITF+ credential.

NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0001 - Knowledge of computer networking concepts and protocols, and network security methodologies.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0002 - Knowledge of risk management processes (e.g., methods for assessing and mitigating risk).

NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0217 - Knowledge of Learning Management Systems and their use in managing learning.

NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0252 - Knowledge of training and education principles and methods for curriculum design, teaching and instruction for individuals and groups, and the measurement of training and education effects.

NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0076 - Skill in configuring and utilizing software-based computer protection tools (e.g., software firewalls, antivirus software, anti-spyware).

5cf62adb-1993-4091-aee0-73dfd5bfe5e9.description: Earners attended "Cybersecurity Essentials + New Auditing and Compliance Content for Teachers" workshop at the 2019 NICE K12 Cybersecurity Education Conference. Badge indicates competence in the latest PC hardware & software technologies with a focus on cybersecurity. Requirements were the completion of hands-on experiences using real network forensics and IDS tools used by today’s cybersecurity professionals, including completion of several new cybersecurity auditing tools and technologies.
5cf62adb-1993-4091-aee0-73dfd5bfe5e9.name: Cybersecurity Essentials Audit and Compliance

issuer.summary: issued by NICE K12 Education Conference

alignments.name: NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework
alignments.description: The NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework (NICE Framework), NIST Special Publication 800-181, is a national-focused resource that categorizes and describes cybersecurity work. The NICE Framework establishes a taxonomy and common lexicon that describes cybersecurity work and workers irrespective of where or for whom the work is performed.

alignments.name: NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standard
alignments.description: The core mission of the National Board for Professional Teaching Standards is to create field-specific standards for accomplished teaching that are grounded in the Five Core Propositions and that articulate the actions that accomplished teachers employ to advance student learning.

alignments.name: PCI Security Standard Council: Data Security Standard (PCI-DSS)
alignments.description: The PCI DSS applies to all entities that store, process, and/or transmit cardholder data. It covers technical and operational system components included in or connected to cardholder data. If you are a merchant who accepts or processes payment cards, you must comply with the PCI DSS.

badge_template_activities.title: Register for the 2019 NICE Cybersecurity Education Pre-Conference Workshop "Cybersecurity Essentials + New Auditing and Compliance Content for Teachers."
Participant must attend the workshop and participate in all activities.

Complete hands-on experiences using real network forensics and IDS tools used by today’s cybersecurity professionals, including completion of several new cybersecurity auditing tools and technologies.
Complete the feedback form for the Workshop using the Whova conference app.
PCI-DSS Standard: Controls 1-12 - Earners completed labs and training for each of the 12 PCI-DSS Controls.

NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standard IV: Learning Environments and Instructional Practices. Accomplished teachers design contextualized learning environments that foster critical thinking, creativity, leadership, teamwork, and communication skills while preparing students for postsecondary education and careers.

NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standard VI Postsecondary Readiness: Accomplished teachers facilitate career exploration and promote the acquisition of knowledge and skills so students can make informed career decisions that match their interests and aptitudes with the needs, expectations, and requirements of industry.

NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standard VIII Partnerships and Collaborations: Accomplished teachers collaborate with family, education, industry, and community partners to create challenging real world opportunities and support networks that help students plan, develop, and achieve their career goals.

NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standard VII Program Design and Management: Accomplished teachers design and promote quality programs aligned with industry demands. They manage materials and resources to enrich their programs and sustain meaningful educational experiences for their students.

NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standard Specialty Area: Information Systems and Technology. Accomplished CTE teachers in information systems and technology have a comprehensive understanding of the design, development, and management of computer software, hardware, and networks.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0001 - Knowledge of computer networking concepts and protocols, and network security methodologies.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0002 - Knowledge of risk management processes (e.g., methods for assessing and mitigating risk).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0003 - Knowledge of laws, regulations, policies, and ethics as they relate to cybersecurity and privacy.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0004 - Knowledge of cybersecurity and privacy principles.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0005 - Knowledge of cyber threats and vulnerabilities.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0006 - Knowledge of specific operational impacts of cybersecurity lapses.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0008 - Knowledge of applicable business processes and operations of customer organizations.

NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0038 - Knowledge of cybersecurity and privacy principles used to manage risks related to the use, processing, storage, and transmission of information or data.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0048 - Knowledge of Risk Management Framework (RMF) requirements.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0146 - Knowledge of the organization's core business/mission processes.

NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0168 - Knowledge of applicable laws, statutes (e.g., in Titles 10, 18, 32, 50 in U.S. Code), Presidential Directives, executive branch guidelines, and/or administrative/criminal legal guidelines and procedures.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0267 - Knowledge of laws, policies, procedures, or governance relevant to cybersecurity for critical infrastructures.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0622 - Knowledge of controls related to the use, processing, storage, and transmission of data.

c57c6e02-b09c-47ee-b5c1-0acc00cde38c.description: Earners of this Badge participated in the Conference Capture-the-Flag (CTF) Challenge at the 2019 NICE K12 Cybersecurity Education Conference December 9-10, 2019.
c57c6e02-b09c-47ee-b5c1-0acc00cde38c.name: NICE K12 Capture-the-Flag Challenge Participant

alignments.description: The NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework (NICE Framework), NIST Special Publication 800-181, is a national-focused resource that categorizes and describes cybersecurity work. The NICE Framework establishes a taxonomy and common lexicon that describes cybersecurity work and workers irrespective of where or for whom the work is performed.

alignments.name: NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standard
alignments.description: The core mission of the National Board for Professional Teaching Standards is to create field-specific standards for accomplished teaching that are grounded in the Five Core Propositions and that articulate the actions that accomplished teachers employ to advance student learning.

alignments.description: This course aligns with the NSA CAE-CD KU's Cybersecurity Foundations (CSF), Basic Cryptography (BCY), Basic Networking (BNW), Digital Forensics (DFS), Network Forensics (NWF) and Software Reverse Engineering (SRE)

badge_template_activities.title: Register for the 2019 NICE Cybersecurity Education Conference.
Register for the Capture-the-Flag (CTF) competition on the Virginia Cyber Range Kali Linux virtual machine.
Participate in the CTF challenge and solve at least three challenges.

NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standard IV: Learning Environments and Instructional Practices. Accomplished teachers design contextualized learning environments that foster critical thinking, creativity, leadership, teamwork, and communication skills while preparing students for postsecondary education and careers.

NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standard VI Postsecondary Readiness: Accomplished teachers facilitate career exploration and promote the acquisition of knowledge and skills so students can make informed career decisions that match their interests and aptitudes with the needs, expectations, and requirements of industry.

NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standard VIII Partnerships and Collaborations: Accomplished teachers collaborate with family, education, industry, and community partners to create challenging real world opportunities and support networks that help students plan, develop, and achieve their career goals.

NBPTS Career and Technical Education Standard Specialty Area: Information Systems and Technology. Accomplished CTE teachers in information systems and technology have a comprehensive understanding of the design, development, and management of computer software, hardware, and networks.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0001 - Knowledge of computer networking concepts and protocols, and network security methodologies.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0004 - Knowledge of cybersecurity and privacy principles.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0058 - Knowledge of network traffic analysis methods.

NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0109 - Knowledge of physical computer components and architectures, including the functions of various components and peripherals (e.g., CPUs, Network Interface Cards, data storage).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0392 - Knowledge of common computer/network infections (virus, Trojan, etc.) and methods of infection (ports, attachments, etc.).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0395 - Knowledge of computer networking fundamentals (i.e., basic computer components of a network, types of networks, etc.).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0427 - Knowledge of encryption algorithms and cyber capabilities/tools (e.g., SSL, PGP).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0435 - Knowledge of fundamental cyber concepts, principles, limitations, and effects.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - K0444 - Knowledge of how Internet applications work (SMTP email, web-based email, chat clients, VOIP).
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0072 - Skill in using scientific rules and methods to solve problems.

NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0211 - Skill in developing or recommending analytic approaches or solutions to problems and situations for which information is incomplete or for which no precedent exists.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0218 - Skill in evaluating information for reliability, validity, and relevance.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - S0289 - Skill in using multiple search engines (e.g., Google, Yahoo, LexisNexis, DataStar) and tools in conducting open-source searches.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0058 -
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0069 - Ability to apply collaborative skills and strategies.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0070 - Ability to apply critical reading/thinking skills.

NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0080 - Ability to develop or recommend analytic approaches or solutions to problems and situations for which information is incomplete or for which no precedent exists.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0083 - Ability to evaluate information for reliability, validity, and relevance.
NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework - A0175 - Ability to examine digital media on multiple operating system platforms.

The CTF aligns with the NSA CAE-CD KU's Cybersecurity Foundations (CSF), Basic Cryptography (BCY), Basic Networking (BNW), Digital Forensics (DFS), Network Forensics (NWF) and Software Reverse Engineering (SRE)
